eg.edu.alexu.csd.datastructure.stack.cs

Class ExpressionEvaluator

  • java.lang.Object
    • eg.edu.alexu.csd.datastructure.stack.cs.ExpressionEvaluator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IExpressionEvaluator

    public class ExpressionEvaluator
extends java.lang.Object
implements IExpressionEvaluator
    the implementation of expression evaluator that contains 2 methods the first one converts the expression from infix form to postfix form using extra differents functions that edit the expression till we reach the right form and the second method evaluate the expression and return the value of it

        Returns:

      • comparePrecedence

        public int comparePrecedence(char a,
                             char b)
        Parameters:
        a - is the operator that we check
        b - is the operator stored in the stack
        Returns:
        1 if the one stored is higher in precedence or 2 if the one that we check is lower in precedence or 3 if the two of them have the same degree of precedence and 0 for any thing else

      • space

        Returns:

      • check

        public java.lang.String check(java.lang.String expression)
        Parameters:
        expression - it take the expression and check if there any condition that can make it invalid as extra operators or successive operators without meaning
        Returns:
        a modifies expression to be worked on in the postfix method

      • minus

        public java.lang.String minus(java.lang.String expression)
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the final expression that enter to the postfix method

      • infixToPostfix

        public java.lang.String infixToPostfix(java.lang.String expression)
        Description copied from interface: IExpressionEvaluator
        Takes a symbolic/numeric infix expression as input and converts it to postfix notation. There is no assumption on spaces between terms or the length of the term (e.g., two digits symbolic or numeric term)
        Specified by:
        infixToPostfix in interface IExpressionEvaluator
        Parameters:
        expression - infix expression
        Returns:
        postfix expression

        Parameters:

        Returns:
